issue.title: Pelvis vs Foot Orientation after teleport

content.raw:
But the script works on a step-by-step basis right?

I believe that the behaviour is not the same if you generate a list of footsteps. We generate all deltas from the initial position, the first step will be alright, but once the world drifts, the second footstep will end up anywhere.

TBH doesn't seem like an issue that we have to start facing 12 days before the finals.

To further develop why this isn't a trivial issue:

We were just thinking to convert our planned step list into relative steps with regards to the previous step. The problem is that the feet slip, a lot. If a foot slips 30º, our next step might send us towards an obstacle. 

It doesn't seem fair  that we have to rewrite our footstep planning code due to a bug originated by teleporting the robot.
